intro: Psychotria stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, black seeds. Psychotria stenocarpa is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
